    • Method Detail

      • getCardsString

        public static java.lang.String getCardsString(Card card1,
                              Card card2)
        Returns a String representation for two (Hole) Cards.

        The first letter is the character for the higher rank and the second letter is the character for the lower rank of the cards. If the cards have different ranks (means: they aren't a pair), a third character follows to indicate, if they are suited or offsuited.

        Examples:
          AA - means a pair of Aces
          T9s - means a 10 and a 9 that are of the same suit
          KQo - means a King and a Queen that are of different suits
        Parameters:
        card1 - The first hole card.
        card2 - The second hole card.

      • getSuit

        public int getSuit()
        Returns the numerical representation of the Card's suit.

      • getRank

        public int getRank()
        Returns the numerical representation of the Card's rank.

      • getSuitString

        public java.lang.String getSuitString()
        Returns the String representation of the suit of the Card.

        For an Ace of Spades it would be s.

      • getRankString

        public java.lang.String getRankString()
        Returns the String representation of the rank of the Card.

        For an Ace of Spades it would be A.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the String representation of the Card.

        For an Ace of Spades it would be As.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        See Also:
